ext_descriptions.ext_description: The area_unit_type is an extensible list of types of area that is used by .
the area type is circular;
the area type is square;
the area type is rectangular.
The geometric_tolerance_modifier is the list of modifiers that is used by .

ext_description.p: indicates that maximum material requirement applies in accordance with ISO 2692 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for maximum material requirement is Ⓜ.

ext_description.p: indicates that least material requirement applies in accordance with ISO 2692 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for least material requirement is Ⓛ.

ext_description.p: indicates that reciprocity requirement applies in accordance with ISO 2692 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for reciprocity requirement is Ⓡ.

ext_description.p: indicates that any cross section applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for any cross section is ACS.

ext_description.p: indicates that free state applies in accordance with ISO 10579 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for free state is Ⓕ.

ext_description.p: indicates that common zone applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for common zone is CZ.

ext_description.p: indicates that minor diameter applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for minor diameter is LD.

ext_description.p: indicates that major diameter applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for major diameter is MD.

ext_description.p: indicates that pitch diameter applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for pitch diameter is PD.

ext_description.p: indicates that line element applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for line element is LE.

ext_description.p: indicates that not convex applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for not convex is NC.

ext_description.p: indicates that the tolerance is based on statistical tolerances;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 this is indicated by <ST>.

ext_description.p: indicates that the datum is the tangent plane established by contacting points;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 this is indicated by Ⓣ.

ext_description.p: indicates that the tolerance zone applies to each radial element individually.
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 this is indicated by EACH RADIAL ELEMENT.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A shape_tolerance_select type indicates that a tolerance can either be a
or a .
The tolerance_method_definition type is the identification of the method used to generate a tolerance value.

ext_description.p: A dimension_related_tolerance_zone_element is an association of a tolerance zone definition with a locating dimension.
ext_description.note: This entity is deprecated. It should not be used for new implementations.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: a dimension that positions the .

a
that is defined with a specific location.

A geometric_tolerance is the specification of the allowable range within which a geometrical property of a product may deviate. A geometric_tolerance is a
and/or a
and/or may be either a
or a
and/or an
and/or one of a , a , a , a , a , a , a .

ext_description.p: the identification of the geometrical tolerance type.
ext_description.note: This identification may be one of the geometrical tolerance types specified in ISO 1101 when used to represent International Standard geometrical tolerances.
ext_description.example: Position, straightness, concentricity, parallelism, circular runout, etc., are names for geometrical tolerance types.

ext_description.p: a supplementary note that shall be used to convey additional requirements associated with geometric tolerance.
ext_description.note: This description may state requirements that may have an affect on the geometric_tolerance for specific applications.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the size of a tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the
to which the tolerance applies.

specifies the role of the
for the geometric_tolerance.
The combination of name and controlling_shape shall be unique within a population of geometric_tolerance.

The
shall be equal or greater than zero.
The controlling_shape shall be populated.
A geometric_tolerance_relationship is an association between two geometric_tolerances.
the word or group of words by which the geometric tolerance relationship is referred.
text that describes the relationship.
one of the geometric_tolerances that takes part in the relationship.
the other geometric_tolerances that takes part in the relationship. If one of the geometric_tolerances is to he dependent on the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.

A geometric_tolerance_with_datum_reference is a type of
that references one or more datums for specifying the tolerance condition of a . Each geometric_tolerance_with_datum_reference may be either an , a , a , a , a , a , a , or a .

ext_description.p:
the
or combination of datums that define a reference for a .
ext_description.note: This attribute is not equivalent to datum system as defined in ISO 5459.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A geometric_tolerance_with_defined_area_unit is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the geometric_tolerance_with_defined_area_unit.

specifies the role of the
for the geometric_tolerance_with_defined_area_unit. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A geometric_tolerance_with_defined_unit is a type of
specified on a per unit basis of the .
ext_description.note: The use and application of the per unit basis are described in ISO 1101.
ext_description.example: A straightness tolerance defines the allowable amount of bending of a product feature on a unit length basis. A flatness tolerance defines the allowable amount of warping of a surface on a per square unit area basis.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the unit measure over which a tolerance applies.
The unit length or area over which the tolerance is applied shall be defined by a positive value.
A geometric_tolerance_with_maximum_tolerance is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the geometric_tolerance_with_maximum_tolerance.
A geometric_tolerance_with_modifiers is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the geometric_tolerance_with_modifiers. There shall exist one or more geometric_tolerance_modifiers for the geometric_tolerance_with_modifiers.

ext_description.p: A limits_and_fits is a pre-defined fit system for specifying the tolerances associated with the assembly of mating product features. Unless otherwise specified limits_and_fits shall be used in accordance ISO 286-1 and ISO 286-2.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the algebraic difference between a size and a corresponding basic size.
the designation to which the tolerance class applies.
the designation of the standard tolerance.
the description of the place for additional information and requirements on this tolerance.

ext_description.p:
A modified_geometric_tolerance is a type of
with a material limit condition that applies to the
being toleranced.
ext_description.note: See ISO 2692. As specified in ISO 2692, this limit condition modifies the tolerance value applied to the toleranced .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
that is assigned to a geometrical tolerance.

The SELF\ shall be a
defining a product feature that has size characteristics.
A non_uniform_zone_definition is a type of .

A plus_minus_tolerance is the specification of the limits within which the value of a dimension may vary. A plus_minus_tolerance may have a range specified by either a
or a .
the limits that, when applied to the dimension value, define the allowable variation for the dimension.
the dimension to which the plus_minus_tolerance applies
There shall be only one plus_minus_tolerance for a dimension.

A projected_zone_definition is a type of
that is projected from a feature of a product. The projection is external to the feature and is made from one of the ends of the feature for a specified length. A projected tolerance zone is defined in ISO 10578.

the
from which the projected tolerance zone originates.
the distance from the feature being toleranced.
The value of the projected_length shall be greater than 0.0.
The dimensional exponents of projected_length shall characterize a length unit.
A projected_zone_definition_with_offset is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the projected_zone_definition_with_offset.

ext_description.p:
A runout_zone_definition is a type of
that is defined by the orientation of the measurement of the toleranced
to the
of a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the orientation of a toleranced
to the centre of symmetry of a .

ext_description.p: A runout_zone_orientation is the specification of the orientation of the runout tolerance element to the centre of symmetry of a .
ext_description.example: Figure 13 illustrates an angle for a runout_zone_orientation. Rules specifying how the angle is measured shall be defined in an application protocol.

ext_description.p:
an angle value that orients the tolerance zone from the centre of symmetry of a datum feature to which the runout zone is applied, or a specific value that is the normal to the surface of the
that is applied to the runout tolerance.
ext_description.note: If a value other than a numeric value is desired then angle may be a .
ext_description.example: An example of an angle defined by a descriptive value may be “normal”.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The angle value shall range from 0 to 90 degrees if the angle is a planar angle.

A runout_zone_orientation_reference_direction is a type of
that specifies the reference direction for the orientation of the angle.

the
which specifies a directed relationship from the
to the
to define the reference direction in which the angle is to be oriented.

ext_description.p:
A statistical_distribution_for_tolerance is a type of
that is defined by a set of measure_representation_items that provide the set of distribution parameters. Each distribution parameter is defined by a name and a .
ext_description.example: Normal Gaussian, Logarithmic or Rayleigh are names for statistical distributions.
Mean and standard deviation are characteristic parameters that define a Normal Gaussian distribution.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The representation_items in the set statistical_distribution_for_tolerance shall be of type .

The name of each parameter that is related to the statistical_distribution_for_tolerance shall be specified in the name attribute of each respective
in the items attribute of the representation

ext_description.p: A tolerance_value is the representation of plus-minus tolerances for a dimension. A tolerance_value specifies the numeric values added to the nominal dimension of a .

The lower_bound and upper_bound are applied to the value of the dimension to determine the acceptable range of measured values. A tolerance_value may be either assigned by the user or specified according to ISO 286-l and ISO 286-2.
ext_description.example:
Since the only constraint on the attribute values is that the upper bound be greater than the lower bound, the specification of a
(e.g., 10.0+0.10+0.05) is permitted. In this case, the nominal dimension, 10.0, is not bounded by its associated tolerance zone.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the value of the tolerance that is added to the dimension value to establish the minimum deviation from the boundary toleranced from the nominal dimension.
the value of the tolerance that is added to the dimension value to establish the maximum deviation from the boundary toleranced from the nominal dimension.
the numeric value of the lower_bound without unit component.
the numeric value of the upper_bound without unit component.
The value of the upper_bound shall be greater then the value of the lower_bound.
The upper_bound and the lower_bound shall have the same unit.

ext_description.p:
A tolerance_with_statistical_distribution is the allocation of a tolerance in terms of a probability distribution. The
may be associated with a tolerance value for a
or a range of tolerances for a .
ext_description.example:
The diameter of a shaft is toleranced by a . The
specifies the range in which the diameter may vary. The
associated to this
specifies that the actual diameter values shall conform to a statistical distribution within the tolerance range.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the tolerance that is specified with a statistical distribution.
the statistical distribution that shall apply to the tolerance

ext_description.p: A tolerance_zone is a type of . A tolerance_zone is the region within which the toleranced feature shall be defined. The characteristics of the region are specified by the manner in which the toleranced feature is dimensioned.
ext_description.example:
A geometric location tolerance applied to a hole defines a
that may be described as cylindrical.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: all geometric tolerances which define a tolerance_zone for a .
the representation of the applied shape that limits the specified tolerance for the tolerance_zone.

ext_description.p:
A tolerance_zone_definition is a specification of the defining boundaries of a tolerance zone. A tolerance_zone_definition may be either a
or a , or a .
ext_description.note: A pair of boundaries specified as a single tolerance_zone_definition may form either a partial or complete tolerance zone.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
being defined.

ext_description.p: a set of shape_aspects that define boundaries of the .
ext_description.example:
A geometric location tolerance applied to a hole is defined to be a cylindrical zone in which the axis of the hole may vary. The cylindrical zone is symmetric about its axis. The two defining boundaries of this tolerance zone are the cylindrical surface and its axis. For a
defined by two parallel planes (or lines), each plane (or line) defines a boundary of the tolerance_zone_definition.

ext_description.p: A tolerance_zone_form is a description of the shape of the .
ext_description.example: “cylindrical”, “spherical”, “parallelepiped”, and “conical” are examples of descriptions of tolerance zone shapes.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the description of a tolerance zone shape
A unequally_disposed_geometric_tolerance is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the unequally_disposed_geometric_tolerance.

The sts_get_product_definition_shape function returns the
associated with the
as an input.
the specified .

An angularity_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with angularity tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively angularity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The specified angle shall not be a multiple of 90 degrees. In the case of 0 or 180 degrees, a
shall be used. In the case of 90 or 270 degrees, a
shall be used. The specified angle shall be defined using an instance of . The
is either a plane or a straight line.
The angularity_tolerance shall contain at least one element and at most two elements in its .
The datums referenced shall be sufficient to identify a plane or a straight line.

The datums referred to in
shall be sufficient to enable orientation of the tolerance zone.

A circular_runout_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with circular run-out tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively circular run-out tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The circular_runout_tolerance shall contain one or two elements in its .

A coaxiality_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with coaxiality tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively coaxiality tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The coaxiality_tolerance shall contain one or two elements in its .
The , the coaxiality_tolerance is applied to, is a revolute surface feature.

A concentricity_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with concentricity tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively concentricity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The concentricity_tolerance shall contain exactly one element in its .
The , the concentricity_tolerance is applied to, is symmetrical with respect to rotation.

A cylindricity_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with cylindricity tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively cylindricity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The cylindricity_tolerance shall not be of type .
The , the cylindricity_tolerance is applied to, is a cylindrical face.

A flatness_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with flatness tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively flatness tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The flatness_tolerance shall not be of type .
The , the flatness_tolerance is applied to, shall be a nominally planar surface.

A line_profile_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with profile tolerance of a line in ISO 1101.
Alternatively profile tolerance of a line can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The line_profile_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

A parallelism_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with parallelism tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively parallelism tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The parallelism_tolerance shall contain at least one element and at most two elements in its .
The , the parallelism_tolerance is applied to, is an axis or a planar surface.
The datums referenced shall be sufficient to define a plane or a straight line.

A perpendicularity_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with perpendicularity tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively perpendicularity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The perpendicularity_tolerance shall contain at least one element and at most three elements in its .

The
shall be either a plane or a straight line.
The datums referenced shall be suffcient to define a plane or a straight line.

A position_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with position tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively position tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
When the
is a , e.g. eight holes, the tolerance zone may but need not be defined by referenced datums (see ISO 1101).
The location of the tolerance zone shall be specified with instances of .
The type
is defined in ISO 10303-47.
The position_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

A roundness_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with roundness tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively roundness tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The
shall be of invariance class surface revolute feature but not a helical shape.
In the case of a sphere, any axis through the center point of the sphere may be considered.
The actual surface shall lie in a tolerance zone limited by two co-planar and concentric circles with a difference in radii of the tolerance value.
The roundness_tolerance shall not be of type .

A straightness_tolerance is a type of
that applies either to the intersection curves between the surface and the planes parallel to the reference plane, or to an axis. Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with straightness tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively straightness tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The
is a surface or a straight line. Refer to the definition of straightness tolerance in ISO 1101 for a description of the different tolerance zones. In the case of intersection curves, the ideal features corresponding to the intersection curves shall be linear and there shall be another , which is related to the
by a . The
of the
shall be 'affected plane association'.
The straightness_tolerance shall not be of type .

A surface_profile_tolerance is a type of
that applies to a surface. Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with profile tolerance of a surface in ISO 1101.
Alternatively profile tolerance of a surface can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The surface_profile_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

The
shall refer to a surface that is neither planar nor cylindrical. In the case where the nominal feature is planar a shall be used. In the case where the nominal feature is cylindrical a shall be used.

A symmetry_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with symmetry tolerancein ISO 1101.
Alternatively symmetry tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The symmetry_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

A total_runout_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with total run-out tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively total run-out tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The set of referenced datums shall contain one revolute surface feature. The tolerance zone is limited either by:
two coaxial cylinders, with a difference in radii equal to the tolerance value. In this case, the axis of the cylinders shall be the axis of the revolute surface feature, and the ideal feature corresponding to the toleranced surface is a cylinder;
two parallel planes, separated by the distance specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the planes are perpendicular to the axis of the revolute surface feature, and the ideal feature corresponding to the toleranced surface is a plane.
The total_runout_tolerance shall contain one or two elements in its .
